item.title: 美国称胡塞武装在红海向中国船只发射导弹
item.description: 美国中央司令部称，以也门为基地的胡塞武装周六向一艘名为 "黄埔号 "的中资油轮发射了一枚导弹。【原文：Yemen-based Houthis fired a missile at a Chinese-owned oil tanker called M/V Huang Pu on Saturday, the US Central Command said.】

item.title: 中国总理淡化经济风险，强调政策空间
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强淡化了投资者对经济面临挑战的担忧，称中国政府正在加大政策支持力度以刺激经济增长，并正在应对系统性风险。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang downplayed investor concerns of challenges facing the economy, saying Beijing is stepping up policy support to spur growth and systemic risks are being addressed.】

item.title: 美国通胀指标有望增强美联储对利率的耐心
item.description: 2 月份，美联储首选的衡量美国潜在通胀的指标可能仍然高得令人不安，这表明央行行长对过早降息持谨慎态度的原因。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s preferred measure of underlying US inflation probably remained uncomfortably high in February, showing why central bankers are wary about cutting interest rate too soon.】

item.title: 零售商转而以 "超低价 "吸引购物者，消费者支出不堪重负
item.description: 在许多周末，伦敦东部一条不起眼的小巷里都会有几十个人排队购买样品：名牌服装的折扣通常高达 70% 或更多。【原文：On many weekends, dozens of people line up in a nondescript alleyway in east London to shop at sample sales: designer clothing offered at discounts that typically stretch to 70% or more.】

item.title: 恩库贝说：尽管亏损，津巴布韦仍将保留本币
item.description: 津巴布韦财政部长姆图利-恩库比（Mthuli Ncube）表示，即使财政和货币当局正在制定新的货币改革计划，津巴布韦仍计划保留本币，因为本币在今年的每个交易日都在贬值。【原文：Zimbabwe plans to keep its local dollar, a currency that has lost value every single trading day of the year, even as fiscal and monetary authorities work on new plans to revamp the currency, according to Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube.】

item.title: 拜登签署1.2万亿美元拨款法案结束停摆威胁
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登签署了一项1.2万亿美元的一揽子拨款计划，该计划将使美国政府的运作持续到9月30日，从而避免了政府部分停摆。【原文：President Joe Biden signed a $1.2 trillion funding package that keeps the US government running through Sept. 30, averting a partial government shutdown.】

item.title: 加纳可可作物产量低，影响头两个月的贸易顺差
item.description: 加纳的可可收成减少，打击了该国的对外收支状况，其贸易顺差在前两个月减少了一半以上，对塞地货币构成风险。【原文：Ghana’s smaller cocoa harvest has hit the country’s external payments position as its trade surplus fell by more than half in the first two months, posing a risk to the cedi currency.】

item.title: 被取缔的交易员在被监管机构抓获前一直工作多年
item.description: 马克-瓦伦丁（Mark Valentine）是一位前金融业高管，近 20 年前，他曾因激进的交易行为而被加拿大监管机构封杀。【原文：Mark Valentine, a former financial industry executive whose aggressive trading earned him a ban from Canadian regulators nearly 20 years ago, never really quit.】

item.title: 意大利撤销对意法半导体首席执行官的反对，与法国冰释前嫌
item.description: 意大利和法国就两国共同控制的芯片制造商意法半导体公司（STMicroelectronics NV）的管理问题达成了一项协议，解决了长达数周的争端。【原文：Italy and France have reached an agreement to settle weeks of dispute over the governance of STMicroelectronics NV, the chipmaker controlled by both countries.】

item.title: 绘制全球经济图表：瑞士降息带来惊喜
item.description: 瑞士国家银行出人意料地在全球同行中首次降息，日本央行行长们结束了现代史上最激进的货币刺激政策，美联储则维持了美国借贷成本的底线。【原文：The Swiss National Bank surprised with the first interest-rate cut among its global peers, central bankers in Japan ended the most aggressive monetary stimulus in modern history and the Federal Reserve held the line on US borrowing costs.】

item.title: 俄罗斯石油终于被制裁所困
item.description: 为克里姆林宫的乌克兰战争提供资金的俄罗斯石油出口机器终于有了些许起色。【原文：The Russian oil-export machine funding the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine is finally getting some grit in its gears.】

item.title: 泰勒-斯威夫特失约后，泰国将举办两场大型音乐活动
item.description: 在错过泰勒-斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）的世界巡回演唱会后，泰国已与夏日音速（Summer Sonic）和明日世界（Tomorrowland）音乐节达成主办协议，推动以活动为导向的旅游业发展，从而推动东南亚第二大经济体的发展。【原文：After missing out on Taylor Swift’s world tour, Thailand has sealed deals to host Summer Sonic and Tomorrowland music festivals as it pushes event-driven tourism to propel Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 可可价格飙升，复活节彩蛋涨价只是开始
item.description: 随着复活节假期的临近，可可价格的上涨意味着购物者要花更多的钱来购买巧克力蛋和兔子。但这只是冰山一角。【原文：As the Easter holidays approach, higher cocoa prices mean shoppers are paying far more for their chocolate eggs and bunnies. But that’s just the tip of the iceberg.】

item.title: 高盛认为德国的投资魅力正在回归
item.description: 德国经济可能仍处于低迷状态，但投资者已开始改变看法。【原文：Germany’s economy may still be in the doldrums, but investors are starting to change their tune.】

item.title: 中国房地产政策会议为房地产行业带来援助希望
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强呼吁进一步优化房地产政策以刺激需求，这表明这一陷入困境的行业可能即将获得更多支持。【原文：China’s Premier Li Qiang called for further optimization of property policies to stimulate demand, in a sign that more support may be on the way for the troubled sector.】

item.title: 苹果公司库克会见中国商务部长，公布投资计划
item.description: 苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）在继续对中国进行高调访问时表示，苹果公司计划进一步投资中国的研究。【原文：Apple Inc. plans to invest further in research in China, Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said as he continues his high-profile visit to the country.】

item.title: 滴滴全球计划香港上市前收入大增
item.description: 滴滴出行第四季度营收同比增长55%，在计划于今年在香港上市之前，这家中国叫车服务领军企业的业绩持续逐步复苏。【原文：Didi Global Inc.’s fourth-quarter revenue rose 55% from a year earlier, sustaining the Chinese ride-hailing leader’s gradual recovery ahead of a planned listing in Hong Kong this year.】

item.title: 墨西哥道达尔游戏公司推出新的交换计划以消除再融资疑虑
item.description: 里卡多-萨利纳斯-普利戈（Ricardo Salinas Pliego）的互联网和有线电视供应商 Total Play Telecomunicaciones SA 提出了一项交换要约，旨在恢复这位亿万富翁在全球投资者心目中的信誉。【原文：Ricardo Salinas Pliego’s internet and cable provider Total Play Telecomunicaciones SA proposed a swap offer aimed at restoring the billionaire’s credibility with global investors following a yearlong roller-coaster ride through distressed territory.】

item.title: Ecopetrol 投资者批准被认为不称职的新董事

item.title: 中国城市在人潮褪去之前抓住了麻辣美食的狂潮
item.description: 大量游客突然涌入这座中国城市，令人应接不暇。政府部门开放了通常受到限制的停车场，以容纳激增的游客。铁路运营商延长了列车服务。官员们紧急召开会议，讨论下一步该怎么做。【原文：The influx of tourists to the Chinese city was sudden and overwhelming. Government offices opened their normally restricted parking lots to accommodate the surge. Railway operators extended train services. Officials held a snap meeting to discuss what to do next.】

item.title: 日本股市繁荣获得的支持不仅限于出口商
item.description: 即使是 2007 年以来的首次加息，也未能减缓日本股市破纪录的飙升势头。【原文：Not even an interest-rate hike for the first time since 2007 has slowed the record-breaking surge in Japanese shares.】

item.title: 芝加哥市长寻求发行 12.5 亿美元住房和发展债券
item.description: 芝加哥市长布兰登-约翰逊（Brandon Johnson）提议出售高达 12.5 亿美元的住房和经济发展债券，在五年内平均分配，以刺激面临人口下降和近年来失去一些知名雇主的城市的经济增长。【原文：Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson is proposing the sale of up to $1.25 billion in housing and economic development bonds, split evenly over five years, to spur growth in the city facing population decline and the loss in recent years of some high-profile employers.】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克预计今年仅降息一次
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）表示，他现在预计今年只会降息一次，并补充说降息时间可能会比他之前预计的晚一些。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic says he now projects just one interest-rate cut this year, adding that reduction will likely happen later in the year than he previously expected.】
